author: goober
content:
I'm confused.  Is this a second volume or a second edition?  My understanding is that a second volume is completely new material, where a second edition is simply the old material corrected and/or brought up to date.

If second volume, one would typically own both volumes 1 & 2.  If second edition, one could simply purchase the second edition and be set.

Which is it?  I'll be buying the newer book regardless...

author: pdp
content: goober, this book is the second edition! it does have a lot of new sections though. thanks!
